intro: Aporuellia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan aporuellia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
